activity.title: Choose Global Earthquake Explorer
activity.exceptionGreeting:
Oooops! Your last command to GEE revealed a bug in our software.
Don't panic ... this is our fault, not yours.
It would be helpful if you could use the Save button at the bottom of this screen to make a file of the details of this problem. After saving the details to a file, please email it to: geebugs@seis.sc.edu and we will try to track down the reason for this little hiccup.
It is hard to tell how this bug will impact your current session of GEE. We recommend that you either try your last command again (it might work ...) or just continue to do what you were doing! If GEE behaves oddly, try selecting "Reset the Global Earthquake Explorer" from the "File" Menu. If GEE still misbehaves, you should probably Quit the program and restart it.
Thanks for your help in improving GEE!

activity.title: Receiver Function Viewer
activity.description: Views receiver functions and H-K stacks stored in the EARS database.

activity.title: "Day Viewer Display"
activity.description: View an entire day's worth of data from a SCEPP station

activity.title: Real Time Data
activity.description: View data currently coming in from seismic stations

activity.title: "World Map"
activity.description: A map of the world with seismic stations and events on it

activity.title: "Default Configuration of the Global Earthquake Explorer"

taskconfig.name: north
taskconfig.value: Welcome to GEE. GEE operates in two fashions: Open Exploration mode, which allows you to use the program in any way you like, and through learning modules, which provide a structured way of learning about a particular topic. Below are all of the modules and open exploration. Click on the go button next to the description of the way you want to use GEE.

taskconfig.name: choices
taskconfig.value: edu/sc/seis/gee/data/images/intro/open-exploration-unclicked.png Access and explore seismograms for recent earthquakes anywhere in the world. doAdvanced edu/sc/seis/gee/data/images/intro/SCEPP-unclicked.png View a whole day of data from an individual seismograph station. doDayViewer edu/sc/seis/gee/data/images/intro/real-time-unclicked.png Watch ground motion at seismograph stations anywhere in the world in real time! doRealTime edu/sc/seis/gee/data/images/intro/seperator.png I am just a seperator! I do nothing! seperator edu/sc/seis/gee/data/images/intro/intro-to-gee-unclicked.png Structured learning module for examining wave properties using a classic earthquake. doIGEE edu/sc/seis/gee/data/images/intro/DLE-unclicked.png Structured learning module to allow students to discover earth structure using a classic earthquake. doDLE edu/sc/seis/gee/data/images/intro/LTW-unclicked.png Structure learning module to explore the differences between P- and S-waves using a classic earthquake. doLTW

task.tooltip: Save this display to a PDF file for printing.

task.name: Zoom In
task.tooltip: Zoom in on a portion of a seismogram with a mouse click.

task.name: Zoom Out
task.tooltip: Zoom out around a portion of a seismogram with a mouse click.

task.name: Drag Seismograms
task.tooltip: Drag a seismogram left or right by holding down the mouse button.

task.name: Reset Zoom
task.tooltip: Reset the display zoom to default value.

task.name: Clear Display
task.tooltip: Clear all seismograms from your display.

task.name: Plot Particle Motion
task.tooltip: Create a particle motion display by clicking on a seismogram.

task.name: Tag Pick Zone
task.tooltip: Select a time region on a seismogram by dragging over a seismogram with mouse held down.
